Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: Junior Data Analyst




Location: Madrid




On-board time: ASAP




About us




We are a technology company, driven by the passion to create the ultimate products, with smart terminals and intelligent services at its core. Founded over 20 years ago, with headquarters in Dongguan, China, we are proud to say that we still have over 80-percent of employees working in R&D, as part of our proprietary research and development system. By now, we have over 300 million active users worldwide, and we are ranked 5th in global market share.







One dream. One team




Holding a firm belief in creating the vivo culture in Europe, we are proud to say that our team is courageous, ambitious, authentic and multicultural with 15 nationalities and growing. We celebrate each nationalities' special day. At vivo, we make sure your voice is heard, and your culture is respected.




At vivo, we commit ourselves to one thing, do the right things and do things right. We support openness and authenticity, promote self-reflection and continuous learning, we thrive to provide a working environment where our talents can perform at their peak.







In a few words




We are seeking a passionate (Junior) Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will support data-driven projects by providing data analysis, assisting with report automation, and participating in the optimization of data systems, thereby supporting strategic decision-making across various departments.




This role will contribute to enhancing organizational efficiency through cross-functional collaboration and data handling.







Your Challenges:




Data Operations & Analysis:

Assist in designing, developing, and maintaining data workflows, utilizing tools like Python, R, or Power Automate to improve efficiency.
Create and maintain Power BI dashboards, applying DAX for data analysis to provide clear insights for cross-functional teams.
Support data management for the Purchase, Sales, Inventory (PSI) system, assisting in enhancing real-time tracking and decision-making capabilities for the Spanish market.
Participate in Profit & Loss (P&L) analysis and market analysis, providing data support for the Spanish business to optimize financial performance.
Assist in developing and implementing solutions to automate reporting processes, reducing manual effort.

Forecasting & Strategic Insights:

Integrate market strategy information, retail-related data, and sales forecasts to assist in the analysis of promotion plans, providing data input for business decisions in the Spanish market.
Prepare daily sales reports and participate in the creation of weekly sales analysis and market reports, identifying key trends, brand performance, and pricing information to support strategic planning.

Collaboration & Communication:

Collaborate closely with retail, sales, and finance teams in Spain to understand data needs and provide corresponding data support.
Clearly explain data findings and basic technical concepts to stakeholders from various backgrounds.







Your profile includes:







Background:

Background in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, or related fields, with programming and quantitative analysis capabilities.
Recent graduates (with at least 6-12 months of relevant internship experience) or candidates with 1+ years of experience as a Junior Data Analyst are welcome to apply.
Proven experience in data analysis, reporting, and dashboard development using Excel and Power BI.

Portfolio (Highly Recommended):

A portfolio demonstrating relevant projects (e.g., GitHub profile, Power BI dashboard examples) is a strong plus.

Technical Skills:

Core Skills:
Proficient in Python and R, with the ability to independently perform data cleaning, processing, and analysis.
Proficient in Power BI for data visualization and dashboard creation, with an understanding of DAX application.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, including Power Query (data cleaning), Power Pivot (data modeling), and Cube Functions (data retrieval).
Understanding of the basic concepts of Microsoft Power Platform (especially Power Automate).
Preferred Skills:
Experience using Python or R for data integration and workflow automation is preferred.
Basic understanding of data system optimization and real-time tracking frameworks.

Communication & Collaboration Skills:

Possess a strong team spirit and the ability to communicate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Good written and verbal communication skills, capable of presenting data findings clearly.

Language Proficiency:

Mandarin Chinese: Fluent
Spanish: Business proficiency.
English: Business proficiency.

Interview Process Note:

Please note that a case study may be required as part of the interview process.







What we offer?




We work hard to ensure that every employee feels supported and encouraged to have a healthy balance between health, work and home commitments. We believe a balanced and healthy life outside of the office makes for a happier, healthier future together.




At vivo, we are committed to providing equal opportunities. We value diversity and inclusion and do not discriminate against people on any basis, such as, but not limited to, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation or disability. We focus on doing the right thing and do things right! We look forward to hearing back from you!







Connect with us!




If this sounds like your next challenge, send us your application at this link

Show more
HTML:
Job Description: Junior Data Analyst


Location: Madrid


On-board time: ASAP


About us


We are a technology company, driven by the passion to create the ultimate products, with smart terminals and intelligent services at its core. Founded over 20 years ago, with headquarters in Dongguan, China, we are proud to say that we still have over 80-percent of employees working in R&D, as part of our proprietary research and development system. By now, we have over 300 million active users worldwide, and we are ranked 5th in global market share.



One dream. One team


Holding a firm belief in creating the vivo culture in Europe, we are proud to say that our team is courageous, ambitious, authentic and multicultural with 15 nationalities and growing. We celebrate each nationalities' special day. At vivo, we make sure your voice is heard, and your culture is respected.


At vivo, we commit ourselves to one thing, do the right things and do things right. We support openness and authenticity, promote self-reflection and continuous learning, we thrive to provide a working environment where our talents can perform at their peak.



In a few words


We are seeking a passionate (Junior) Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will support data-driven projects by providing data analysis, assisting with report automation, and participating in the optimization of data systems, thereby supporting strategic decision-making across various departments.


This role will contribute to enhancing organizational efficiency through cross-functional collaboration and data handling.



Your Challenges:


Data Operations & Analysis:

  • Assist in designing, developing, and maintaining data workflows, utilizing tools like Python, R, or Power Automate to improve efficiency.
  • Create and maintain Power BI dashboards, applying DAX for data analysis to provide clear insights for cross-functional teams.
  • Support data management for the Purchase, Sales, Inventory (PSI) system, assisting in enhancing real-time tracking and decision-making capabilities for the Spanish market.
  • Participate in Profit & Loss (P&L) analysis and market analysis, providing data support for the Spanish business to optimize financial performance.
  • Assist in developing and implementing solutions to automate reporting processes, reducing manual effort.

Forecasting & Strategic Insights:

  • Integrate market strategy information, retail-related data, and sales forecasts to assist in the analysis of promotion plans, providing data input for business decisions in the Spanish market.
  • Prepare daily sales reports and participate in the creation of weekly sales analysis and market reports, identifying key trends, brand performance, and pricing information to support strategic planning.

Collaboration & Communication:

  • Collaborate closely with retail, sales, and finance teams in Spain to understand data needs and provide corresponding data support.
  • Clearly explain data findings and basic technical concepts to stakeholders from various backgrounds.



Your profile includes:



Background:

  • Background in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, or related fields, with programming and quantitative analysis capabilities.
  • Recent graduates (with at least 6-12 months of relevant internship experience) or candidates with 1+ years of experience as a Junior Data Analyst are welcome to apply.
  • Proven experience in data analysis, reporting, and dashboard development using Excel and Power BI.

Portfolio (Highly Recommended):

  • A portfolio demonstrating relevant projects (e.g., GitHub profile, Power BI dashboard examples) is a strong plus.

Technical Skills:

  • Core Skills:
  • Proficient in Python and R, with the ability to independently perform data cleaning, processing, and analysis.
  • Proficient in Power BI for data visualization and dashboard creation, with an understanding of DAX application.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel, including Power Query (data cleaning), Power Pivot (data modeling), and Cube Functions (data retrieval).
  • Understanding of the basic concepts of Microsoft Power Platform (especially Power Automate).
  • Preferred Skills:
  • Experience using Python or R for data integration and workflow automation is preferred.
  • Basic understanding of data system optimization and real-time tracking frameworks.

Communication & Collaboration Skills:

  • Possess a strong team spirit and the ability to communicate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, capable of presenting data findings clearly.

Language Proficiency:

  • Mandarin Chinese: Fluent
  • Spanish: Business proficiency.
  • English: Business proficiency.

Interview Process Note:

  • Please note that a case study may be required as part of the interview process.



What we offer?


We work hard to ensure that every employee feels supported and encouraged to have a healthy balance between health, work and home commitments. We believe a balanced and healthy life outside of the office makes for a happier, healthier future together.


At vivo, we are committed to providing equal opportunities. We value diversity and inclusion and do not discriminate against people on any basis, such as, but not limited to, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation or disability. We focus on doing the right thing and do things right! We look forward to hearing back from you!



Connect with us!


If this sounds like your next challenge, send us your application at this link

Title: Analyst, Analytics & Insights Delivery
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description



The Global Business Optimisation team has a simple mission: we turn massive amounts of data into actionable insights that drive business value. Our analytic consultants and data analysts work with Visa’s clients, partners, and staff to improve portfolio performance, program profitability, and cardholder experiences. By coupling in-depth analysis of cardholder behaviour with Visa’s world-class products, digital offerings, and marketing capabilities, we ensure our clients’ programs operate at their peak potential and that cardholders have seamless commerce experiences in both the physical and digital world.



As part of the Client Services organisation, this role will take ownership of this vision and deliver with excellence for our organisation and our clients. The successful candidate will use strong big data and analytical skills, contextual business sense, and a creative flair to solve real-world business challenges for Visa issuing banks, acquirers, merchants, and processors. In addition, your analytic expertise will directly impact the strategic direction of the organisation and how we deliver value from our data assets.



The successful candidate will be a key member in Global Business Optimisation, within Client Services, supporting all aspects of improving and optimising payment success, including but not exclusive to authentication and authorisation. Responsible for building and deploying a single source of truth on insights, facts, and reporting related to the Visa Europe Regions payment processing.



Responsibilities



Assist other team members in deriving analytic insights on client performance and deliver findings to external and internal stakeholders, by proactively advising on how to improve performance.
Formulate and source necessary datasets from internal tools and platforms, rendering insights in compelling presentations and visualizations.
Create and present analytic deliverables to external Visa clients, colleagues in the analytics team, and other internal stakeholders with varying degrees of analytical and technical expertise.
Develop specific knowledge on authentication and/or authorisation, with active monitoring and client meetings to help them improve and optimise performance.
Identify and understand the root cause of problems, define analytical objectives, and formalise data requirements for various types of analyses.
Combine and analyse disparate data sources and derive insights in a Big Data environment.
Work with a pan-European team located in multiple locations and contribute to global projects.
Proactively facilitate the overall analytic delivery strategy for the organisation.
Compare client performance against industry best practices to identify performance and/or profitability improvement opportunities.
Present complex data and content to clients in an accurate, understandable, and engaging manner, considering stakeholders' varying degrees of analytical and technical expertise by translating analysis and insights into stakeholder & client language.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.





Qualifications



2+ years of working experience in a corporate environment.
Visa experience or knowledge of the payments industry is highly preferable.
Knowledge of the Authorisation/ Authentication process is highly preferable.
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills required.
Proven client presentation skills.
Proactive, curious, problem solver with experience of being a self-starter and a willingness to learn.
Experience working in data analysis and/or insight delivery with a proven record of creating business value from data.
Basic level of manipulating data from a variety of sources - Big data skills (Hadoop, Hive, Spark) and/or SQL skills is an advantage.
Experience visualizing data with tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Must be proficient in all MS Office applications with advanced Excel spreadsheet skills.
Excellent spoken and written command of English.
Knowledge of additional European language(s) is an advantage.





Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¡Hola #Red! 🌟




¿Estás buscando una oportunidad para trabajar como Data Analyst especializado en temas de calidad de datos? ¡Tu oportunidad ha llegado! 🌍




Definición de la Posición: En esta posición, serás responsable de analizar la calidad de los datos, identificando las causas raíz en los datos, procesos y sistemas. Trabajarás junto a nuestros expertos en datos y líderes de aplicaciones de TI para abordar problemas de calidad de datos de clientes📊




Tareas a Realizar:

Analizar Procesos de Negocio Existentes:

Realizar entrevistas con stakeholders para recopilar información y documentación. 💻
Examinar datos de clientes para identificar patrones de baja calidad de datos y determinar causas raíz. 📄
Documentar flujos de datos actuales y delinear puntos críticos de negocio a través de casos de uso de alto nivel. 🛠️

Definir Requisitos Futuros:

Resumir necesidades de negocio en casos de uso de alto nivel. 🔍
Desarrollar historias de usuario detalladas y necesidades que guiarán el diseño y desarrollo de sistemas y plataformas de datos objetivo. 🎯

Contribuir a Iniciativas de Gestión de Datos:

Colaborar en la definición de componentes de datos conceptuales y lo que constituye alta calidad de datos. 💡
Ayudar a establecer métricas de calidad de datos para asegurar que los datos se mantengan en un alto estándar. 🗣️
Desarrollar directrices y proporcionar soporte a recursos basados en países durante el proceso de transformación. 📈




Competencias Necesarias:

Idioma: Inglés B2+, C1. 🏆
Habilidades técnicas: SQL, Excel, Python, Tableau. 🛠️
Comprensión de los desafíos de datos de clientes. 🌍




Modelo de Trabajo:

Trabajo 100% remoto, con fuerte preferencia por ubicaciones en Grenoble, París, Barcelona. 🌍

Requisitos, Habilidades y Cualificaciones:

Experiencia como Business Analyst. 🎯
Excelentes habilidades de documentación y comunicación escrita. 💡
Fuertes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas. 🗣️
Experiencia trabajando con datos en plataformas de TI. 📈
Familiaridad con sistemas de datos, incluyendo Master Data Management (MDM) y entornos de análisis. 🌍
Comprensión general de estructuras de datos y sus aplicaciones. 🏙️
Conocimiento de gestión de proyectos es un plus. 📩
Capacidad para trabajar de manera independiente y llevar tareas a término de manera efectiva. 📊




Si tienes pasión por la tecnología y experiencia como Data Analyst, ¡queremos conocerte! 🌐 Envíanos tu currículo y únete a nosotros. 🚀




Estamos esperando tu candidatura! 📩

Title: Data Analyst (SQL) - Madrid
Description:
Lo que buscamos es…




En Garaje buscamos un Data Analyst con al menos 3 años de experiencia en labores de análisis de datos con el objetivo de trabajar en colaboración con equipo de analistas para impulsar el negocio de uno de nuestros principales clientes dentro del sector energía. Queremos incorporar un perfil con conocimiento avanzado en lenguajes de procesamiento de datos (SQL) y desarrollo en Python que además aporte experiencia en la extracción de insights.




Y en concreto, esto es lo que harás:




Diseñar y redactar queries SQL para que las ejecute el equipo con acceso a datos
Trasladar los requerimientos y KPIs a nivel negocio a informes de fácil consumo por los principales stakeholders de la compañía
Definir y documentar KPIs alineados con objetivos de negocio
Generar extracciones de datos para el seguimiento diario a través de herramientas como Excel
Validar resultados y detectar errores o inconsistencias en los datos entregados
Extraer insights relevantes a partir del análisis de los funnels de conversión y segmentando
Crear visualizaciones básicas/intermedias con herramientas ligeras (Excel, Python, etc.)
Especificar lógica de transformación de datos para procesos ETL.
Proponer mejoras en métricas y estructuras de datos.
Colaborar con distintos equipos (datos, negocio, producto) para resolver necesidades analíticas
Identificar patrones o desviaciones en los indicadores clave.




Para eso, necesitamos que tengas…




Conocimiento avanzado en SQL & DBT
Conocimiento en proyectos para desarrollo con Python
Conocimiento avanzado en Excel
Grandes capacidades comunicativas, facilitando así la comprensión de los datos a stakeholders de diferentes áreas dentro de una compañía
Experiencia en la explotación de información desde herramientas de Big Data como Google BigQuery
Valorable experiencias previas en la explotación de dashboards como Power BI
Capacidades demostrables en la generación de informes y reports de alto nivel para las compañías
Experiencias previas en la explotación de datos a través de herramientas de marketing (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics… )




En Garaje nos gustan las personas que…




Se enorgullecen de su trabajo, dan lo mejor de sí mismas, se divierten siempre, son valientes y se arriesgan, aprenden de los errores y aman lo que hacen.

Nuestra actitud se define por la pasión con la que nos involucramos en nuestros proyectos, la empatía y cercanía que mostramos hacia nuestros clientes, y nuestra ambición de ir más allá de lo correcto.




En Garaje...Somos | No somos:




➔ Somos personas humildes y cercanas [pero no serviles ni simplistas]

➔ Somos personas apasionadas y expertas [pero no abrumadoras ni pretenciosas]

➔ Somos makers con propósito [pero no meras hacedoras o gurús]

➔ Somos personas valientes y consecuentes [pero no insensatas o irresponsables]

➔ Somos autoexigentes [pero no bloqueantes]




Y las ventajas con las que contarás son:




Contrato indefinido: Queremos que te sientas parte de Garaje y que puedas crecer con nosotros a largo plazo.
Flexibilidad horaria: Tenemos horario flexible para que puedas adaptar tu jornada laboral a tu vida personal. Puedes ajustar tanto tu hora de entrada como de salida según las dinámicas y necesidades de conciliación, equipo y proyecto. Y en verano podrás disfrutar de jornada intensiva.
Actualmente, tenemos dos días al mes programados por la compañía (10% del total) en los que debes venir a las oficinas de Garaje. Esto lo hacemos para garantizar que todo el mundo tenga contacto con los demás más allá de una pantalla de vez en cuando. Aunque en este caso el cliente requiere un par de díaa de presencialidad en Madrid se puede requerir tu presencia en las oficinas del cliente.
Seguro médico con Adeslas: Accede al seguro de Garaje con beneficios fiscales. Además, puedes incluir a tu pareja e hijos. Sin copagos, carencias ni cuestionarios.
Retribución flexible: Ahorra en IRPF dedicando parte de tu salario a ticket restaurante, transporte y guardería.
26 días de descanso: Descansa con 23 días de vacaciones y festivos regionales. Además, te concedemos 2 días adicionales libres en Navidad y en tu cumpleaños para celebrar momentos especiales.
Incentivos: Trae nuevos clientes o empleados a Garaje y te pagamos por ello. ¡Sé parte del crecimiento!
Cultura de la transparencia: Creemos en la comunicación abierta y compartimos periódicamente la situación y objetivos de la compañía en nuestros All Hands, newsletter..
G-Book: Nuestro oráculo. En Garaje, tenemos una guía en Notion que resuelve todo tipo de dudas. Allí, puedes encontrar respuestas a preguntas que van desde cómo solicitar días libres y conocer quién es quién, hasta cómo preparar una guía de prueba, plantillas corporativas para entregables o presentaciones de proyectos similares como referencia... ¡No te sentirás perdido!
Eventos y dinámicas frecuentes: Compartimos conocimiento y aprendizajes de los proyectos constantemente. Como nos gusta pasar tiempo juntos, también organizamos eventos informales para conocernos mejor y divertirnos como equipo.
Bono de 500€: Incentivamos tu desarrollo profesional con un bono de 500€ para que inviertas en formación, aprendizaje de idiomas, libros o eventos del sector.
Entorno de alto crecimiento: Evoluciona tu carrera en Garaje y trabaja en equipos multidisciplinarios de Diseño, Data, Growth y Tecnología, creando experiencias, servicios y productos con impacto para grandes clientes como Vodafone, BBVA, Endesa, Banco Santander, Inditex, Telefónica, Adeslas, Repsol, IKEA, Legálitas, RBI y Grupo Dani García. Ser parte del equipo de Garaje significa tener la oportunidad de contribuir a la creación de experiencias, servicios y productos con un impacto significativo.
Trabajarás entendiendo la data como una disciplina siempre ligada a todas las fases de diseño y desarrollo de producto, sentando bases sólidas en visualización, personalización y optimización para mejorar la experiencia de usuario y facilitar la toma de decisiones.




¿Qué pasará ahora?




Si te suena bien, haz click en “solicitar”, ¡estamos esperando tu candidatura con ganas!




Si tu perfil encaja con lo que estamos buscando, nos pondremos en contacto contigo pronto para coordinar una primera llamada telefónica de acercamiento. Si avanzas, conocerás a alguien del equipo.

Show more

  • Contrato indefinido: Queremos que te sientas parte de Garaje y que puedas crecer con nosotros a largo plazo.
  • Flexibilidad horaria: Tenemos horario flexible para que puedas adaptar tu jornada laboral a tu vida personal. Puedes ajustar tanto tu hora de entrada como de salida según las dinámicas y necesidades de conciliación, equipo y proyecto. Y en verano podrás disfrutar de jornada intensiva.
  • Actualmente, tenemos dos días al mes programados por la compañía (10% del total) en los que debes venir a las oficinas de Garaje. Esto lo hacemos para garantizar que todo el mundo tenga contacto con los demás más allá de una pantalla de vez en cuando. Aunque en este caso el cliente requiere un par de díaa de presencialidad en Madrid se puede requerir tu presencia en las oficinas del cliente.
  • Seguro médico con Adeslas: Accede al seguro de Garaje con beneficios fiscales. Además, puedes incluir a tu pareja e hijos. Sin copagos, carencias ni cuestionarios.
  • Retribución flexible: Ahorra en IRPF dedicando parte de tu salario a ticket restaurante, transporte y guardería.
  • 26 días de descanso: Descansa con 23 días de vacaciones y festivos regionales. Además, te concedemos 2 días adicionales libres en Navidad y en tu cumpleaños para celebrar momentos especiales.
  • Incentivos: Trae nuevos clientes o empleados a Garaje y te pagamos por ello. ¡Sé parte del crecimiento!
  • Cultura de la transparencia: Creemos en la comunicación abierta y compartimos periódicamente la situación y objetivos de la compañía en nuestros All Hands, newsletter..
  • G-Book: Nuestro oráculo. En Garaje, tenemos una guía en Notion que resuelve todo tipo de dudas. Allí, puedes encontrar respuestas a preguntas que van desde cómo solicitar días libres y conocer quién es quién, hasta cómo preparar una guía de prueba, plantillas corporativas para entregables o presentaciones de proyectos similares como referencia... ¡No te sentirás perdido!
  • Eventos y dinámicas frecuentes: Compartimos conocimiento y aprendizajes de los proyectos constantemente. Como nos gusta pasar tiempo juntos, también organizamos eventos informales para conocernos mejor y divertirnos como equipo.
  • Bono de 500€: Incentivamos tu desarrollo profesional con un bono de 500€ para que inviertas en formación, aprendizaje de idiomas, libros o eventos del sector.
  • Entorno de alto crecimiento: Evoluciona tu carrera en Garaje y trabaja en equipos multidisciplinarios de Diseño, Data, Growth y Tecnología, creando experiencias, servicios y productos con impacto para grandes clientes como Vodafone, BBVA, Endesa, Banco Santander, Inditex, Telefónica, Adeslas, Repsol, IKEA, Legálitas, RBI y Grupo Dani García. Ser parte del equipo de Garaje significa tener la oportunidad de contribuir a la creación de experiencias, servicios y productos con un impacto significativo.
  • Trabajarás entendiendo la data como una disciplina siempre ligada a todas las fases de diseño y desarrollo de producto, sentando bases sólidas en visualización, personalización y optimización para mejorar la experiencia de usuario y facilitar la toma de decisiones.


¿Qué pasará ahora?


Si te suena bien, haz click en “solicitar”, ¡estamos esperando tu candidatura con ganas!


Si tu perfil encaja con lo que estamos buscando, nos pondremos en contacto contigo pronto para coordinar una primera llamada telefónica de acercamiento. Si avanzas, conocerás a alguien del equipo.

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando 1 perfil de Data Analyst Power BI para integrarse en nuestro equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis Spain donde llevamos a cabo importantes proyectos de Inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura con clientes nacionales e internacionales, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.

REQUISITOS TÉCNICOS


Experiencia demostrable en el uso de Power BI para la creación de informes y dashboards.
Conocimientos sólidos en modelado de datos y lenguaje DAX.
Familiaridad con bases de datos relacionales y consultas en SQL.
Capacidad para analizar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer insights relevantes.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y presentación.
Valorable contar con certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.
Valorable contar con experiencia en herramientas de ETL y procesos de integración de datos.
Valorable contar con conocimientos en otras herramientas de visualización de datos.


RESPONSABILIDADES


Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI.
Colaborar con equipos multifuncionales para comprender los requisitos de negocio y traducirlos en soluciones de datos efectivas.
Optimizar modelos de datos y consultas para mejorar el rendimiento de los informes.
Garantizar la calidad y precisión de los datos presentados en los dashboards.
Proporcionar soporte y formación a usuarios finales sobre el uso de Power BI.


BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto desde cualquier punto de España.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description



We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are
At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we’ve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising €250M to revolutionize digital advertising.

Your Challenge

You will propose a new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding.
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasping the attention of the public and transmitting complex information into simple explanations.
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients.
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc).
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales to marketing to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day.
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and actively propose improvements together with the Product Team.
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!

What You’ll Need to Succeed
You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics-related field.
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must.
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative solutions.
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English.
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment.
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills.
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment.
You like to have fun while working and don’t take yourself too serious!
It would be a big plus if you
Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.

Why Join Seedtag?
Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.
Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO and optional English or Spanish group classes.
Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.
Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company off-sites, and more!

Additional Perks
Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage is included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV, and let’s grow together!

At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process, and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That’s why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years’ experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers’ decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive – we succeed together
Trusting – we choose to trust each other
Customer committed – we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused – we accelerate change
Curious – we turn knowledge into action


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie’s Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include


Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
Renewable technology supplier leaderboards


Responsibilities


Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements


About You


At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Finsolutia intends to reinforce its Information Technology (IT) team with a Data Analyst (M/F).

We are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Design and develop Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
Build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications
Designing database tables and related objects;
Transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
Extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, Power BI and DAX.
Design, develop, update, and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.


Hard Skills


Understanding of T-SQL programming (Microsoft SQL Server )
Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices
2+ years of experience in creating reports, dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
Understanding of tuning of Power BI reports, data sets, and SQL to deliver maximum report performance.
Experience with ETL Processes Experience with Python and C# (nice to have)
Fluent in English


Soft Skills


Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
Team work and result oriented;
Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.


At Finsolutia, we evaluate all candidates in a fair and equitable manner, ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates, based solely on the skills, experience, and competencies required for the position. No candidate in this process will be discriminated against based on race, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, or any other personal characteristic. Our commitment is to ensure an inclusive environment and equal opportunities for all candidates.

Para su conocimiento le informamos que los datos personales recogidos por esta vía se destinarán única y exclusivamente, a la gestión profesional del proceso de reclutamiento en cuestión y serán procesados y almacenados por Finsolutia Spain SLU, en conformidad con lo dispuesto en el Reglamento (UE) 2016/679 de 27 de abril de 2016. Esta información se conservará por un plazo máximo de 4 años en caso de participar en algún proceso de selección. Le informamos que puede oponerse en cualquier momento al almacenamiento y tratamiento de sus datos, así como revocar el consentimiento prestado y ejercitar los derechos de acceso, rectificación y cancelación, en los términos previstos en la normativa aplicable. Para ejercitar estos derechos puede dirigirse personalmente o por correo postal, adjuntando fotocopia del DNI a Recruitment Department: Finsolutia Spain, SLU – c/Cardenal Marcelo Spínola 14, 4 planta, 28016. Madrid, España; o bien, mediante escrito, acompañado de copia de documento oficial que le identifique dirigido a dpo@finsolutia.com


Show more
HTML:
Finsolutia intends to reinforce its Information Technology (IT) team with a Data Analyst (M/F).

We are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Madrid.

Responsibilities

  • Design and develop Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
  • Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
  • Build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
  • Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
  • Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications
  • Designing database tables and related objects;
  • Transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
  • Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
  • Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
  • Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
  • Extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, Power BI and DAX.
  • Design, develop, update, and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.

Hard Skills

  • Understanding of T-SQL programming (Microsoft SQL Server )
  • Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices
  • 2+ years of experience in creating reports, dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
  • Understanding of tuning of Power BI reports, data sets, and SQL to deliver maximum report performance.
  • Experience with ETL Processes Experience with Python and C# (nice to have)
  • Fluent in English

Soft Skills

  • Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
  • Team work and result oriented;
  • Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.

At Finsolutia, we evaluate all candidates in a fair and equitable manner, ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates, based solely on the skills, experience, and competencies required for the position. No candidate in this process will be discriminated against based on race, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, or any other personal characteristic. Our commitment is to ensure an inclusive environment and equal opportunities for all candidates.

Title: Power BI Consultant (^)
Description:
En BETWEEN te ofrecemos las oportunidades que necesitas para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales. Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en IT e Ingeniería ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Firmware, Software, BI, Diseño, Project Management y muchas más. Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros BETWEEN Labs.

Estamos buscando un/a Consultor/a de Power BI para ampliar uno de nuestros equipos en Madrid, en el área de visualización (BI) para dar soporte al dominio de Logística.

Funciones

Como Consultor De Power BI, Serás Responsable De Diseñar e Implementar Soluciones De Visualización De Datos Que Ayuden a Tomar Decisiones . Tus Principales Responsabilidades Incluirán


Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards e informes interactivos en Power BI y MicroStrategy.
Colaborar con los equipos de negocio para entender sus necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones efectivas de BI.
Evaluar y optimizar el rendimiento de los informes existentes, proponiendo mejoras continuas en la visualización de datos.


Beneficios

En BETWEEN, Valoramos a Nuestros Empleados y Ofrecemos Una Serie De Beneficios Diseñados Para Mejorar Su Bienestar y Desarrollo Profesional


Seguro médico con Sanitas: Para cuidar de tu salud y la de tu familia.
Oportunidades de formación: Acceso a cursos de idiomas, certificaciones, bootcamps y otros programas de desarrollo profesional.
Multitud de eventos: Participa en actividades como BETWEEN Night, Torneo de Padel, Black Mamba Race y muchas más, para fomentar la convivencia y el trabajo en equipo.
Retribución flexible: Disfruta de beneficios en restaurantes, transporte y guarderías que se adaptan a tus necesidades.
Incentivos por validar o recomendar talento: Te recompensamos por ayudar a formar un equipo sólido y talentoso en nuestras filas.


Si cumples con un mínimo de 3 años de experiencia en el área de BI, especialmente en herramientas como Power BI y Microstrategy, y deseas sumarte a un equipo dinámico y con proyectos innovadores, no dudes en unirte a nosotros en BETWEEN Technology. Juntos, transformaremos la manera en que nuestros clientes entienden y utilizan sus datos.

Requisitos

Requisitos


Experiencia mínima de 3-5 años en PBI.
Valorable MicroStrategy.
Valorable experiencia en el sector de Logística.
Capacidad para interpretar datos complejos, identificar patrones y proponer soluciones.
Habilidad para traducir análisis técnicos en insights comprensibles para usuarios no técnicos.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That’s why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years’ experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers’ decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive – we succeed together
Trusting – we choose to trust each other
Customer committed – we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused – we accelerate change
Curious – we turn knowledge into action


Role Purpose

The Data Analyst will play a key role in advancing forecasting and modelling efforts by managing, analysing, and optimising large datasets across renewable, conventional, and storage assets globally. Working on asset revenue forecasting, power dispatch modelling, or power markets data, the analyst will focus on automating workflows, ensuring data quality, and delivering actionable insights through close collaboration with research, engineering, and product teams. This role contributes directly to improving forecasting accuracy and enhancing the company's global asset performance and revenue strategies.

Responsibilities

Knowledge


Structures poorly defined problems, gathers feedback, and solves them effectively.
Defines hypotheses and appropriate analysis approaches.
Ensures statistical validity of results while avoiding common pitfalls.
Develops deep technical expertise and emerging domain knowledge in forecasting or dispatch modelling.
Provides specialist skills in data analysis, visualisation, and data management.
Fully understands the technical data landscape within the energy domain.
Maintains a growth mindset, continually evolving their skills.


Impact


Performs defined and repeatable tasks with limited guidance.
Independently formulates new analyses and project components.
Carries out independent analysis on specific areas of forecasting or modelling projects.
Delivers high-quality outputs on time, recognised for accuracy and reliability.
Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL or Python for data handling.


Collaboration


Supports data governance and quality assurance activities.
Engages directly with stakeholders, building confidence in data-driven outcomes.
Works closely with peers in Research, Product, Data, Data Engineering, and other business functions.


Innovation


Identifies opportunities for efficiency, optimisation, or new data creation within their focus area.
Uses technical and domain knowledge to create new value and insights.


Specialisms

General


Owns and manages data within their role or team focus.
Leverages specialist toolsets or domain expertise for data analysis and decision-making.


Data Modelling


Applies best practices in data modelling to support use cases.
Translates data requirements into effective data structures.
Collaborates with engineers to enhance data modelling capabilities for large-scale datasets.


Key Expectations

Experience & Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
2–4 years of experience in data analysis, including handling large, complex datasets.
Advanced SQL skills for querying and managing relational databases.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Sisense, Power BI, Streamlit).


Technical Skills


Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration.
Understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like Snowflake is advantageous.
Knowledge of data governance frameworks and data security protocols.


Soft Skills


Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities.
Strong communication skills, able to translate complex insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborative mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on energy sector trends.


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/*)
Description:
Thank you for your interest in working for our Company. Recruiting the right talent is crucial to our goals. On April 1, 2024, 3M Healthcare underwent a corporate spin-off leading to the creation of a new company named Solventum. We are still in the process of updating our Careers Page and applicant documents, which currently have 3M branding. Please bear with us. In the interim, our Privacy Policy here: https://www.solventum.com/en-us/home/legal/website-privacy-statement/applicant-privacy/ continues to apply to any personal information you submit, and the 3M-branded positions listed on our Careers Page are for Solventum positions. As it was with 3M, at Solventum all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Description

3M Health Care is now Solventum

At Solventum, we enable better, smarter, safer healthcare to improve lives. As a new company with a long legacy of creating breakthrough solutions for our customers’ toughest challenges, we pioneer game-changing innovations at the intersection of health, material and data science that change patients' lives for the better while enabling healthcare professionals to perform at their best. Because people, and their wellbeing, are at the heart of every scientific advancement we pursue.

We partner closely with the brightest minds in healthcare to ensure that every solution we create melds the latest technology with compassion and empathy. Because at Solventum, we never stop solving for you.

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As a Data Analyst (m/f/*) In The EMEA DS Sales Excellence Team, You Will Have The Opportunity To Tap Into Your Curiosity And Collaborate With Some Of The Most Innovative And Diverse People Around The World. Here, You Will Make An Impact By


EMEA DS data analysis including internal data and external raw data to provide data-based insights to drive growth and increase share of wallet
Advanced Analytics: Perform complex data analysis using Power BI's DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and Power Query to deliver actionable insights
SQL Expertise: Write complex SQL queries for data extraction and transformation. Work closely with data engineers to ensure efficient data pipelines are in place.
Snowflake Integration: Work with Snowflake databases for data storage, retrieval, and transformation. Optimize SQL queries to efficiently extract and manipulate data within Snowflake.
Power BI Security Model: Implement and manage Power BI security configurations such as row-level security (RLS) to ensure data security and privacy compliance.
Collaboration & Communication: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting needs and translate them into actionable Power BI solutions.
Data Quality & Integrity: Ensure high-quality, accurate, and consistent data by performing data validation and quality checks.
Performance Optimization: Optimize Power BI reports and dashboards for faster load times and overall better performance.
Documentation & Training: Create and maintain documentation for Power BI dashboards, data models, and security configurations. Train end-users on the use of Power BI reports and features.


Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, Solventum requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field
Profound experience in Power BI development and analytics
Profound experience in Power BI or BI Tool’s development with proven experience in building dashboards and reports from scratch
Proficiency in SQL, Snowflake, Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and related tools such as Power Query and DAX for advanced calculations
Experience with advanced analytics techniques such as predictive modeling, statistical analysis, or machine learning integration into Power BI
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and experience working with large data sets
Knowledge of data visualization best practices to ensure clarity and usability of reports and dashboards
Strong attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines


Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status.

Supporting Your Well-being

Solventum offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, Solventum regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Diversity & Inclusion

(*) We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, civil status, disability, family status, or membership of the travelling community.

Solventum is committed to maintaining the highest standards of integrity and professionalism in our recruitment process. Applicants must remain alert to fraudulent job postings and recruitment schemes that falsely claim to represent Solventum and seek to exploit job seekers.

Please note that all email communications from Solventum regarding job opportunities with the company will be from an email with a domain of @solventum.com. Be wary of unsolicited emails or messages regarding Solventum job opportunities from emails with other email domains.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

Solventum Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at Solventum are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the

terms.

Title: Data Analyst – Contact Center Operations
Description:
Company Description

At MSX International, a North American multinational and leading consultancy for the automotive industry, we have over 500 experts in Spain and Portugal dedicated to developing and implementing innovative solutions that enhance our clients' business processes and outcomes.

With more than 25 years of industry experience, our multilingual and multicultural Contact Center operates with a proactive and dynamic approach. Our diverse team consistently contributes ideas, makes informed decisions, and collaborates to ensure each client feels unique and fully satisfied with our exceptional service.

Today, our team comprises over 170 professionals, and thanks to our commitment to excellence, we continue to grow!

Job Description

Do you have a passion for data analytics and making sense of complex information?

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our team and support our Contact Center operations. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain data models and dashboards, delivering actionable insights into customer data. This technical position is key to driving decision-making and identifying new opportunities to enhance performance.

Key Responsibilities


Design and develop KPI dashboards to enhance decision-making and performance tracking.
Leverage data mining techniques and reporting tools to create insightful reports and dashboards.
Prepare analytics reports in a clear and professional presentation format.
Collaborate on establishing effective data ETL practices and processes.
Conduct research and analyze ad-hoc studies as required.
Document process flows and business rules, ensuring up-to-date and accurate records.
Process and analyze large datasets, keeping current reports updated and relevant.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in fast-paced industries like automotive or similar businesses preferred.
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Proficiency in SQL for querying relational databases.
Expertise in data manipulation, complex analysis, and statistical modeling.
Excellent analytical skills to interpret and communicate data insights effectively.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with ETL tools (e.g., SSIS, Alteryx, KNIME).
Familiarity with Training, Learning, Development, or Talent Management teams.
Strong multitasking, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Detail-oriented with a proactive and solutions-driven mindset.
Full professional proficiency in English is required.
Ability to perform advanced statistical analysis.


Additional Information

What we offer:


Be part of a great team of professionals in an internationally consolidated company.
MSX Bazaar: A collective purchasing portal with fantastic discounts for employees.
The possibility to join the Flexible Compensation Plan (including medical insurance, transport card, meal card, training, and more).
23 working days of vacation per year, as stipulated by the collective agreement.
Additional incentives such as employee referral programs, opportunities as internal trainers, recognition for new business contributions, and more.
You will be working from our Madrid office in a 50% hybrid position, with the first 5-6 months approx. fully on-site for the adaptation period. Our office is located at C. de Albasanz, 15, San Blas-Canillejas, 28037 Madrid.
Salary: €30,000 gross per year.


MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

At MSX International, a North American multinational and leading consultancy for the automotive industry, we have over 500 experts in Spain and Portugal dedicated to developing and implementing innovative solutions that enhance our clients' business processes and outcomes.

With more than 25 years of industry experience, our multilingual and multicultural Contact Center operates with a proactive and dynamic approach. Our diverse team consistently contributes ideas, makes informed decisions, and collaborates to ensure each client feels unique and fully satisfied with our exceptional service.

Today, our team comprises over 170 professionals, and thanks to our commitment to excellence, we continue to grow!

Job Description

Do you have a passion for data analytics and making sense of complex information?

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our team and support our Contact Center operations. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain data models and dashboards, delivering actionable insights into customer data. This technical position is key to driving decision-making and identifying new opportunities to enhance performance.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and develop KPI dashboards to enhance decision-making and performance tracking.
  • Leverage data mining techniques and reporting tools to create insightful reports and dashboards.
  • Prepare analytics reports in a clear and professional presentation format.
  • Collaborate on establishing effective data ETL practices and processes.
  • Conduct research and analyze ad-hoc studies as required.
  • Document process flows and business rules, ensuring up-to-date and accurate records.
  • Process and analyze large datasets, keeping current reports updated and relevant.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • 1-3 years of experience in fast-paced industries like automotive or similar businesses preferred.
  • Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Proficiency in SQL for querying relational databases.
  • Expertise in data manipulation, complex analysis, and statistical modeling.
  • Excellent analytical skills to interpret and communicate data insights effectively.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with ETL tools (e.g., SSIS, Alteryx, KNIME).
  • Familiarity with Training, Learning, Development, or Talent Management teams.
  • Strong multitasking, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
  • Detail-oriented with a proactive and solutions-driven mindset.
  • Full professional proficiency in English is required.
  • Ability to perform advanced statistical analysis.

Additional Information

What we offer:

  • Be part of a great team of professionals in an internationally consolidated company.
  • MSX Bazaar: A collective purchasing portal with fantastic discounts for employees.
  • The possibility to join the Flexible Compensation Plan (including medical insurance, transport card, meal card, training, and more).
  • 23 working days of vacation per year, as stipulated by the collective agreement.
  • Additional incentives such as employee referral programs, opportunities as internal trainers, recognition for new business contributions, and more.
  • You will be working from our Madrid office in a 50% hybrid position, with the first 5-6 months approx. fully on-site for the adaptation period. Our office is located at C. de Albasanz, 15, San Blas-Canillejas, 28037 Madrid.
  • Salary: €30,000 gross per year.

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Analista de datos con SQL alto
Description:
Cognodata es una empresa líder en el sector de Customer Science y en Marketing Automation, dedicada a la generación de resultados de negocio mediante la gestión avanzada de la información de clientes, liderando cambios del sector y mejora de su posición competitiva.

Actualmente buscamos un/a analista de datos con experiencia en SQL y ganas de aprender dentro de un proyecto de adquirencia.

Funciones y Responsabilidades


Documentación de proyectos: Registro y organización de toda la información relacionada con los proyectos analizados.
Análisis de datos con SQL: Utilización del lenguaje SQL para extraer, manipular y analizar datos de diversas bases de datos.
Análisis y optimización de resultados de campañas: Evaluación del rendimiento de campañas de marketing y propuesta de mejoras basadas en datos.
Creación, mantenimiento y limpieza de BBDD: Diseño y mantenimiento de bases de datos, asegurando la calidad y precisión de los datos presentes.


Habilidades Necesarias


Compromiso 💪
Iniciativa 🚀
Comunicación efectiva 🗣️
Autonomía 🤝
Capacidad de adaptación 🌍


Podemos ofrecerte:

Un Puesto Dinámico En El Sector Bancario Donde Podrás Desarrollar Tus Habilidades y Contribuir Al Éxito De Nuestros Proyectos. Además


📄 Contrato indefinido.
🚀 Carrera profesional: tienes dos evaluaciones al año
📚 Formación: udemy, LKD learning, plataformas de idiomas...
😊 Buen ambiente laboral
⏰ Flexibilidad horaria
🕒 Horario: jornada completa
🏠 Teletrabajo: híbrido.


¿Quieres conocer más? ¡Ínscribete!

Requisitos mínimos

Requisitos Mínimos


Estudios relacionados con informática.
Conocimientos avanzados de SQL (se realizará prueba)
Conocimientos medio-alto en Excel
Valorable: Inglés alto
Valorable conocimiento en Tableau y Power BI

Title: Data Analyst/ Data Management
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst/ Data Management professional with 8 to 11 years of experience. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Azure Conversational Language AWS CodePipeline AWS CodeDeploy AWS CodeCommit and AWS CodeBuild. This hybrid role requires a strong technical background and the ability to manage data effectively. The position operates during the day shift and does not require travel.

Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify patterns and trends.
Develop and maintain data management systems to ensure data integrity and security.
Utilize Azure Conversational Language to enhance data processing and analysis.
Implement and manage AWS CodePipeline for continuous integration and delivery.
Oversee AWS CodeDeploy to automate application deployments.
Manage AWS CodeCommit repositories to ensure efficient version control.
Utilize AWS CodeBuild to automate the build process.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data requirements.
Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support business decisions.
Ensure data quality and consistency across various data sources.
Create and maintain documentation for data management processes and procedures.
Monitor data management systems to identify and resolve issues promptly.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to improve data management practices.


Qualifications


Possess strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Demonstrate proficiency in Azure Conversational Language.
Have hands-on experience with AWS CodePipeline AWS CodeDeploy AWS CodeCommit and AWS CodeBuild.
Exhibit excellent problem-solving abilities.
Show strong communication and collaboration skills.
Have a solid understanding of data management principles.
Be able to work independently and as part of a team.
Display a proactive approach to identifying and addressing data-related issues.
Hold a relevant certification in AWS or Azure technologies.
Demonstrate the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Show a commitment to continuous learning and professional development.
Have a strong understanding of data security and privacy regulations.
Be able to adapt to a hybrid work model and manage time effectively.

Title: Analista Digital
Description:
Te apasiona el análisis de datos y el marketing digital? 🚀 ¿Te gustaría formar parte de un equipo innovador en una de las aseguradoras más importantes del país? En Línea Directa Aseguradora, estamos buscando un Analista Digital para unirse a nuestro dinámico equipo de marketing. Si eres una persona proactiva, con habilidades analíticas y ganas de transformar datos en estrategias efectivas, ¡esta es tu oportunidad! 🌟







Funciones:

📈 Manejo de BBDD y tratamiento estadístico de datos.
🕵️‍♂️ Análisis del Comportamiento del Usuario.
❓ Responder a preguntas de negocio profundizando en todas las fuentes digitales de información disponibles.
📝 Redacción y estructuración de informes claros y concisos para resolver cuestiones y problemas de negocio.
🔄 Participación en proyectos de transformación del negocio.
🌍 Interés por conocer y rediseñar procesos globales utilizando lógica y analítica de datos.
🤝 Trabajo en equipo, persona resolutiva, proactiva, con iniciativa, autonomía y capacidad de planificación.

Requisitos indispensables:

🎓 Titulación universitaria en Estadística, Matemáticas, Actuaría, ADE, Marketing o cualquier otra titulación de Ciencias.
📊 Conocimiento de Data Collection.
🏷️ Conocimiento de herramientas de gestión de Tags como GTM, Tealium o similares.
💻 Nociones de JavaScript.
📉 Conocimiento de Data Analysis: analizar la información y obtener conclusiones basadas en datos.
📊 GA4: Experiencia con Google Analytics 4 #GA4 de un año o herramienta similar.
🗃️ BigQuery: nociones de BigQuery y conocimientos básicos de SQL.
📊 Excel avanzado.
🎥 Herramientas de grabación de sesiones: Hotjar, FullStory, Clarity.
📈 Conocimiento de Data Delivery: conocimientos en Looker Studio o Power BI.
🔄 Conocimiento de Data Activation: transformar conclusiones en cambios tangibles y experimentos.
🧪 Nociones de herramientas de AB testing como AB Tasty, VWO, Optimizely o similares.
🧩 Prueba técnica de SQL y analítica web.
🌟 Buen desempeño en su puesto actual.

Competencias:

🔍 Buscar tendencias.
🧠 Capacidad para analizar.
💡 Generar soluciones.
📚 Capacidad de aprendizaje.
🔄 Romper hábitos.
🌟 Adaptación al cambio.
🤝 Colaborar.
🌍 Perspectiva global.
📅 Planificar y alinear.
🚀 Empuje por obtener resultados.







¡Esperamos tu candidatura! 🚀📧

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
🎯 Your mission

We are looking for a top-class Data Analyst to become part of our Partner Lifecycle team. This role will help the team better understand opportunities to activate and engage users, as well as enable senior stakeholders to understand the impact of the campaigns and make some of the most important decisions to ensure the long-term success of Playtomic. If you’re someone that enjoys challenges and building things from the ground up, this is the role for you!

👩🏽‍💻 What you’ll be doing


Provide internal stakeholders support on all data related queries, including verifying data quality, analyzing data, isolating and diagnosing problems and resolving issues.
Be a key part of the Partner Lifecycle team.
Assist in designing and analyzing experiments (A/B testing, dif. in dif. etc.).
Design, publish and maintain Looker dashboards and visualization tools to facilitate campaign optimization and stakeholder reporting.
Conduct exploratory analysis and translate insights into quantifiable business opportunities.
Analyze and interpret CRM data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable data-driven insights.
Ensure seamless integration of data into Braze for targeted and personalized messaging.



🦄 Our Ideal Player


3+ years work experience in data analysis, engineering or other technical positions.
BS/MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics or other disciplines with demonstrated technical exposure.
Strong analytical mindset to deliver effective & pragmatic solutions.
Strong SQL skills - able to extract, manipulate, transform and analyze large volumes of data with a high level of accuracy.
Excellent communication, visualization & storytelling with data skills to both scientific and business audiences.
Outstanding attention to detail - you are methodical and thorough in your analyses (problem statement, data discovery to result communication).
Strong understanding of incrementality testing across multiple platforms.
Native/Fluent Spanish and proficient English



🤓 Extra points:


A strong grasp of statistical concepts, especially those related to experiment design and analysis.
Good knowledge of BigQuery.
Certification in Braze or equivalent CRM platforms
Located in Barcelona/Madrid and love racket sports!


🤝 What’s in it for you


Salary: Depending on experience, to be discussed in the People Team Interview
23 days of vacation + day off on your birthday + 2 days off for Wellness days in August.
1 additional day off per year worked.
Hybrid / Remote work.
Flexibility to attend team-building events.
Social benefits (63€ a month in one of these: health insurance/tickets restaurant), flexible spending (pre-tax) in training, kindergarten, and transportation.
Gympass discount
Perks related to the brand and our sponsorship agreements
Summer work schedule (July-August 7h/day Monday to Friday)



➡️ Our hiring process

Last, and for you to start warming up, we want to show you what our process looks like:


First Interview - with our Head of Partner Lifecycle
People Interview - Cultural fit in Playtomic, to define the conditions of our offer
Technical Interview - with a team member from Data
Final Interview with stakeholders from the Partner Development team



About Us 🎾

We are the world’s largest racket sports App for players and clubs. Our goal is to socialize sports practice: through the app, players can book courts, find other players with similar skill levels, and join a social community dedicated to playing. Since 2017, Playtomic has earned the trust of national and international investors, consolidating it as one of the main world players in sports digitalization., You will find 200+ co-workers around the world with headquarters in Spain and offices in Italy, Portugal, Sweden, Finland, Belgium, UK, EEUU and Mexico.

Take a look to our candidate playbook!
