  • Capture the essence of databases and extract key information for meaningful insights.
  • Own key-user meetings to capture feedback on existing processes.
  • Maintain process tools for sales (SAP, excel, sharepoint, powerpoint) updated and aligned across different platforms.
  • Improve Enercon’s data quality.

Your Qualifications

  • Degree in Business, Data/Business Analytics, Data science, Finance, Engineering.
  • Proficiency in Data Analysis Tools: Excel, Python, DAX.
  • Experience with Data Visualization Tools: Power BI (needed), SAC is a plus.
  • Experience with SAP is a plus.
  • Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, perform ad-hoc analyses quickly and provide actionable insights.
  • Attention to Detail: Ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent data visualization skills, with the ability to tailor presentations/dashboards to various audiences.
  • Excellent communication skills in English, German is a plus.

Your Benefits

  • Friendly and challenging working environment.
  • Opportunity for professional growth in an international environment.
  • Flexible and hybrid working systems to support your life balance.
  • Competitive remuneration package.
  • Life & medical insurances.
  • Meal card.
  • Fitness promotion programme.

Ready for this challenge, please resgister and enclose your CV and a motivation letter tailored to the fulfillment of the above responsibilities and profile.

Data Analyst for Commercial Risk Processes (m/f/d) Location: Barcelona

Title: Growth Data Analyst
Description:
Your mission

Your mission

Skills

We are looking for a highly motivated Growth Analyst to join our Growth and Marketing team. In this role you will work closely with growth, marketing, product, and business teams to drive growth and optimize marketing efforts by delivering actionable insights through data analysis, and supporting data-driven decision-making. This will be a highly analytical role, that will require a mix of cross-collaboration, operations, creativity and strong communication skills. More specifically you will be responsible for the following:


Work with growth and marketing to identify opportunities to optimize always on activities and campaigns, and drive overall growth and marketing success.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance metrics (KPIs), and implement specific dashboards to support leadership.
Analyze data sets to identify patterns, trends, and insights to inform growth and marketing decisions.
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights for growth and marketing teams.
Work closely with growth, marketing, product and strategy to promote the implementation of conclusions and bring business-wide improvements.
Investigate and attribute data anomalies, build automated anomaly attribution tools.
Support Livo data foundations, ranging from data modeling to tooling to consume data across the organisation.
Contribute to building a data-driven culture within Livo.


Your profile

What We're Looking For


Bachelor's degree or above, majoring in statistics or data science is preferred.
At least 3+ years of experience in growth analytics, data analysis, or a similar role in a high-performance technology company
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to delivering high-quality insights. Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL and Python.
Knowledge of modern data tools such as Airbyte, Fivetran, or equivanet.
Experience with data visualization tools like Metabase, Looker, or similar platforms.
Experience with A/B testing, experimentation, and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud-based data storage and management services.
Strong spoken and written English and Spanish is a must. Other languages are nice to have.
Self-starter with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.


Why us?

At Livo Health, we offer a unique opportunity to make a tangible impact in the healthcare space. You will play a pivotal role in scaling our operations, all while working alongside passionate individuals who are driven to make a difference.


High Growth: Work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with countless opportunities for personal and professional development.
Competitive salary package: reflecting your experience and expertise, ensuring you are rewarded for your hard work and dedication
Meaningful equity package: We truly want team members to own a relevant part of the business as a key driver to fully buy into the equity story and the change we’re trying to promote in the world, with the corresponding economic upside that goes with it
Innovation: Be at the forefront of transforming healthcare staffing through technology and innovative operational processes.
Impact: Help solve one of healthcare’s most critical issues — healthcare professional talent crisis/shortage — and make a real-world impact on healthcare providers and patients alike.
Cool & vibrant Offices: Very well located offices at the heart of Barcelona in Paseo de Gracia with plenty of natural light, great views, spacious and cool vibes
Culture: Strong culture with an emphasis on ownership, impact, and ambition, coupled with the determination to build something meaningful whilst enjoying the journey
Benefits: We will soon rollout a benefits program in line with market standards


Interview Process

Our hiring process is designed to assess both your skills and cultural fit with our mission-driven team:


Call with HR: initial conversation to assess motivation, culture fit and salary expectations
45-minute interview with our VP of Growth, David
60-minute technical SQL & Programming call with Backend Engineer
45-minute Case Study with our VP of Growth and CEO
45-minute culture fit call with CEO


About Us

Livo was born with the mission to improve healthcare globally through cutting edge technology and that has always been our North Star since we deeply believe health is the most important asset we all have as individuals. We launched last year in Spain our nursing shift marketplace whose aim is to support health care institutions with their nurse staffing needs, by matching institutions with healthcare professionals that are interested in extra work, adding transparency, flexibility and convenience to both stakeholders and its traction has been outstanding. Our vision is to radically transform the way healthcare institutions hire, retain and manage talent nowadays whilst empowering healthcare staff with more tools, flexibility, money, and recognition.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Engineer
Description:
Join our team as a Data Analyst at AXA Partners Barcelona!

Are you passionate about data analysis and want to be part of the transformation towards a data-driven company?

At AXA Partners, we are on an exciting journey to make data more relevant in strategic decision-making. We are looking for a talented Data Analyst who can actively contribute to our data strategy.

What will you do?

As a Data Analyst, you will be a key player in delivering rich and reliable data assets.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Developing and maintaining advanced analytical systems: Design, test, and deliver data assets that provide valuable insights for decision-making.
Ensuring the quality and sustainability of data assets: Implement quality routines and collaborate with experts to enhance our data platform.
Promoting the use of analytics within your team and the organization: Participate in data analysis projects, supporting the adoption of technologies and best practices.
Collaborating with the Data Analysts community: Share your knowledge and projects, and promote a culture of collaboration.


Your Profile

Profile We Are Looking For


Education: Master's degree in Business Intelligence with a specialization in Big Data.
Experience: 3-5 years in a production BI environment, with experience in data warehousing/analytics projects in multicultural organizations.
Technical skills:


Proficiency in BI tools (Power BI, SQL, SSAS, DAX, among others) and best practices in dimensional modeling.

Good understanding of the software development process (git, ci/cd, etc.) and knowledge in Azure DevOps is a plus.

Business Intelligence theory (dimensional modeling: Kimball, star schema, etc., database, data warehousing, datamarts, dimensional and tabular cube, KPI, etc.)


Languages: Fluent in English; French is a plus.
Agile mindset: Ability to work in an international and complex environment, with a focus on creativity and innovation.


AXA Partners is committed to diversity and inclusion, on an equal basis.

Join a company that helps protect the forests! At AXA Partners, we plant a tree for every new recruit (with a permanent contract).

Learn more about the Reforest Program here here.

About AXA

AXA Group is the world leader in insurance and asset management. We protect and advise our clients at every step in their lives, by offering products and services which satisfy their needs in the areas of insurance, personal protection, saving and asset management. AXA is the leading insurance brand worldwide, with over 100 million clients. We are transforming from payer to partner for our client, with a strong focus on risk prevention.

Our mission: Empower people to live a better life.

Our values: Customer First, Courage, Integrity and One AXA.

About The Entity

AXA Partners is an AXA transversal business unit offering a wide range of solutions in assistance services, travel insurance and credit protection.

AXA Partners’ role is also to implement innovative solutions emerging from the AXA Innovation unit.

Combining passion with advanced expertise, we design and deliver worldwide solutions for partners and communities. We protect what matters, when it matters.

What We Offer

By joining AXA Partners, you will work in a responsible company, which offers a real culture of expertise & diversity. Our focus is on accelerating the development of everyone’s skills, whilst offering attractive and competitive compensation and opportunities for professional development and growth.

Additionally, at AXA, we work to make a real difference to people - when amazing things happen and when we create opportunities for a better life, the feeling of pride is extraordinary.

Title: Logistics Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo’s logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary

The Business Unit Printing & Converting (BUPC) is looking for a Data Analyst.

Your main mission will be to translate data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business. This global position will be a key enabler for the BU in the achievement of our 2025 profitability.

You will be a key member of the BUPC Finance team with the role to manage and enhance our reporting capabilities while working closely with the Data Engineering team. This role involves gathering business requirements, developing insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency across various dashboards. The ideal candidate will be proficient in analytics tools and have a deep understanding of business needs.

The BU Printing & Converting includes 11 Manufacturing sites in a context of a new ERP harmonization across all entities, and covers the following main streams Finance & Controlling, Operations, Sales & Marketing, R&D.

Main Responsibilities

Report Development:


Design, develop, reports and dashboards
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability
Translate complex data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Work closely with business teams to understand reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Plan data source acquisition ahead with data engineers to deliver reports in a timely manner
Propose and maintain UX / UI best practices


Continuous Improvement & Documentation:


Document reporting processes, methodologies, and data definitions.
Recommend improvements to reporting tools and workflows to enhance efficiency.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analytics and visualization.


Data Quality & Validation:


Identify and escalate data inconsistencies or anomalies to the data engineering team.


Support the Finance team’s evolution from basic reporting to new state of the art business intelligence tools

Accompany users to change

Process changes and corrective maintenance

Support IT Data & Analytics operating model

Create Data Analytics key users’ community within the BU

Professional Experience

You have a Bachelor Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.

3+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.

Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau® (certification), Power BI, and Excel.

Knowledge of SAP HANA, Anaplan / OneStream is a plus

Experience working with large datasets and data warehouses.

Personal Attributes

Innovative spirit and interest in company processes

Solution oriented mindset

Drive to continuously improve your area

High sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability

Great data visualization skills by presenting analytical findings in a clear and concise manner

Adaptable to work to both technical and non-technical audiences

Team player with good communication skills

Excellent level in English (French is a plus)

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Sobre nosotros: 


En ORBIDI, somos pioneros en el uso de tecnología avanzada, inteligencia artificial y modelos predictivos para propulsar el crecimiento de las pequeñas y medianas empresas (PYMEs). Nuestra pasión por la innovación y el marketing nos motiva a buscar soluciones creativas que permitan a las empresas no solo competir, sino destacar en el mercado actual. Creemos firmemente en el poder de la digitalización y cómo esta puede transformar los negocios para mejor. Buscamos talentos creativos y estratégicos que compartan nuestra visión y deseo de hacer una diferencia tangible en el mundo empresarial.

El rol:

Estamos buscando un/a  Data Analyst (con enfoque en Operaciones y Ventas) para unirse a nuestro equipo y liderar iniciativas clave en análisis avanzado, forecasting y visualización de datos. 

Tu trabajo será fundamental para guiar decisiones estratégicas en operaciones y ventas, mediante el diseño de modelos predictivos, reporting inteligente y análisis profundo de datos.

¿Cuál será tu misión?




Diseñar, implementar y optimizar modelos de aprendizaje automático enfocados en eficiencia operativa y predicción de ventas.


Explorar y procesar grandes volúmenes de datos, garantizando su calidad e integridad.


Crear dashboards interactivos y visualizaciones impactantes que ayuden a los equipos de operaciones y ventas a entender los datos y tomar mejores decisiones.


Colaborar de forma transversal con equipos de producto, ingeniería, operaciones y ventas para entender sus retos y proponer soluciones basadas en datos.


Aplicar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas como regresión, pruebas de hipótesis o análisis de series temporales para prever tendencias y mejorar procesos.


Diseñar y analizar experimentos A/B para validar hipótesis y optimizar resultados.


Trabajar con herramientas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) y tecnologías de Big Data para desarrollar soluciones escalables y eficientes.


Contribuir al desarrollo de una cultura de datos sólida, participando en la definición de políticas de gobernanza y buenas prácticas.

Lo que te hará triunfar:

+2 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos, análisis o machine learning, preferiblemente aplicados a operaciones y ventas.

Dominio de Python o R, junto con bibliotecas como Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn.

Conocimiento sólido en SQL y experiencia consultando bases de datos complejas.

Experiencia utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o matplotlib.

Familiaridad con plataformas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure).

Habilidad para traducir resultados técnicos en mensajes claros y accionables para stakeholders no técnicos.

Mentalidad proactiva, enfoque en la colaboración y pasión por resolver problemas complejos.

Beneficios:

🕑Flexibilidad horaria
💎Oficinas modernas en Sant Cugat, frente a la estación de FGC de Mirasol.
💰Salario competitivo y contrato indefinido
🤑Bonus basado en el cumplimiento de objetivos de tu equipo
🌴23 días laborales de vacaciones + 🎂día de cumpleaños
🏠Formato Híbrido/ Remoto
😍Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del año.
📅Agosto flexible
🥳Actividades de teambuilding y celebraciones y off-sites
🤩Referral Program
🤸🏻‍♀️Descuento en gimnasio
🍎Fruta en oficina

Si tienes una pasión por el marketing digital, la creación de contenido y el diseño, y buscas un rol donde puedas dejar tu huella y contribuir al éxito de las PYMEs, ¡ORBIDI es el lugar para ti! Te invitamos a aplicar y ser parte de nuestro equipo creativo y estratégico.


Show more
HTML:
Sobre nosotros: 

En ORBIDI, somos pioneros en el uso de tecnología avanzada, inteligencia artificial y modelos predictivos para propulsar el crecimiento de las pequeñas y medianas empresas (PYMEs). Nuestra pasión por la innovación y el marketing nos motiva a buscar soluciones creativas que permitan a las empresas no solo competir, sino destacar en el mercado actual. Creemos firmemente en el poder de la digitalización y cómo esta puede transformar los negocios para mejor. Buscamos talentos creativos y estratégicos que compartan nuestra visión y deseo de hacer una diferencia tangible en el mundo empresarial.

El rol:

Estamos buscando un/a  Data Analyst (con enfoque en Operaciones y Ventas) para unirse a nuestro equipo y liderar iniciativas clave en análisis avanzado, forecasting y visualización de datos. 

Tu trabajo será fundamental para guiar decisiones estratégicas en operaciones y ventas, mediante el diseño de modelos predictivos, reporting inteligente y análisis profundo de datos.

¿Cuál será tu misión?


  • Diseñar, implementar y optimizar modelos de aprendizaje automático enfocados en eficiencia operativa y predicción de ventas.

  • Explorar y procesar grandes volúmenes de datos, garantizando su calidad e integridad.

  • Crear dashboards interactivos y visualizaciones impactantes que ayuden a los equipos de operaciones y ventas a entender los datos y tomar mejores decisiones.

  • Colaborar de forma transversal con equipos de producto, ingeniería, operaciones y ventas para entender sus retos y proponer soluciones basadas en datos.

  • Aplicar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas como regresión, pruebas de hipótesis o análisis de series temporales para prever tendencias y mejorar procesos.

  • Diseñar y analizar experimentos A/B para validar hipótesis y optimizar resultados.

  • Trabajar con herramientas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) y tecnologías de Big Data para desarrollar soluciones escalables y eficientes.

  • Contribuir al desarrollo de una cultura de datos sólida, participando en la definición de políticas de gobernanza y buenas prácticas.

    • Lo que te hará triunfar:

  • +2 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos, análisis o machine learning, preferiblemente aplicados a operaciones y ventas.

  • Dominio de Python o R, junto con bibliotecas como Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn.

  • Conocimiento sólido en SQL y experiencia consultando bases de datos complejas.

  • Experiencia utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o matplotlib.

  • Familiaridad con plataformas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure).

  • Habilidad para traducir resultados técnicos en mensajes claros y accionables para stakeholders no técnicos.

  • Mentalidad proactiva, enfoque en la colaboración y pasión por resolver problemas complejos.

    Beneficios:

    • 🕑Flexibilidad horaria
    • 💎Oficinas modernas en Sant Cugat, frente a la estación de FGC de Mirasol.
    • 💰Salario competitivo y contrato indefinido
    • 🤑Bonus basado en el cumplimiento de objetivos de tu equipo
    • 🌴23 días laborales de vacaciones + 🎂día de cumpleaños
    • 🏠Formato Híbrido/ Remoto
    • 😍Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del año.
    • 📅Agosto flexible
    • 🥳Actividades de teambuilding y celebraciones y off-sites
    • 🤩Referral Program
    • 🤸🏻‍♀️Descuento en gimnasio
    • 🍎Fruta en oficina

    Si tienes una pasión por el marketing digital, la creación de contenido y el diseño, y buscas un rol donde puedas dejar tu huella y contribuir al éxito de las PYMEs, ¡ORBIDI es el lugar para ti! Te invitamos a aplicar y ser parte de nuestro equipo creativo y estratégico.

Title: Data Analyst, Partner Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

You will be directly responsible for improving the Partners’ experience across their whole journey, making them grow and improve user UX, from the data perspective. The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented, analytical, and passionate about innovation and entrepreneurship. The role would mean not only providing data and insights to guide the team to make the right decisions but also owning full projects related to the Partners. Ownership and responsibilities will be given to you from day one.

THE JOURNEY


Create and manage core data products that are used to execute impact analysis to evaluate our project performance.
Improve current data sources & reporting to make faster decisions.
Ensure data pipelines and development processes are operationalprocesses operational and efficient.
Work on strategic analysis that will help to detect further opportunities
Understand, deep-dive and have a complete awareness of Glovo’s partner operations situation at all times. Develop analytical frameworks, analyses, dashboards and models for the whole organization.
Raise product requests to improve partners' UX and scalability. Identify tech feature improvements and give proactive feedback to the Product team.
Execute end-to-end projects at a global level


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1/2 years of experience providing business teams with data for decision-making
Analytical skills: breaking big problems into smaller ones and problem-solving skills, with adaptability to change, is a must
Experience developing in Python and writing complex SQL queries is a must
Experience with reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, and Google Data Studio is a must
Experience with data engineering-related tools (Airflow, Github, etc) is a plus.
Good communication skills in English (plus Spanish as a bonus)
Great team player and organizational skills
Experience in managing projects is a plus
International studies or experience is a plus


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions?

Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics?

Are you ready to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data – we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth.

Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your key responsibilities You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients.

Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include

Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analyticsDriving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setupPlanning, project management, and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basisAdvising and configuration of e.g.

Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setupsDeveloping documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setupsImplementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platformsDebugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues About your future team You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed.

We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together.

Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you'll contribute to building a collaborative environment.

You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork, and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g.

a digital agency or an in-house role in a digital company.

You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You

High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerceHave a working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScriptHave experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisationsComfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writingAble to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locationsAre a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasksAre detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutionsHave a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedbackAppreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured mannerNote: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What we offer You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry's top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before.

You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:

A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional developmentFreedom under responsibility and flexible working hoursAmbitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employeesOur office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city's best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We'd love to hear from you! Is this the right fit for you?

Then don't hesitate to apply or reach out to Alex Sauer, VP & Group Head of Measurement at ******.

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible.

All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About s360 s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise.

With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain.

In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

Title: Data Analyst - Insights (Paid Marketing Optimization)
HTML:
We power people’s progress.

At Preply, we’re all about creating life-changing learning experiences. We help people discover the magic of the perfect tutor, craft a personalized learning journey, and stay motivated to keep growing. Our approach is human-led, tech-enabled - and it’s creating real impact. So far, 90,000 tutors have delivered over 20 million lessons to learners in more than 175 countries. Every Preply lesson sparks change, fuels ambition, and drives progress that matters.

Meet the team!

At Preply, we're growing a talented Data Team to empower top-notch decision-making across our organization. Our team collaborates closely with various other chapters - including product, business, and platform - leveraging analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning.

You’ll be embedded in cross-functional teams, partnering with our MarTech Product Manager, Marketeers, Tech Leads, and the Data Strategy team. Check out our Tech Radar to see the tools and technologies we love using at Preply!

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Own and design Preply’s marketing performance dashboard in Looker, ensuring it serves as the single source of truth for decision-making;
  • Be the go-to person for our channel managers, conducting deep dives into channel performance, campaign performance and creative performance;
  • Perform elasticity analysis to identify saturated or high potential markets and channels and to maximize our efficiency;
  • Setup automated processes with our Data Strategy team to identify outliers and in-efficiencies in our marketing spend;
  • Leverage SQL and LookML to build custom data models and explorers for self-serve analytics;
  • Work closely with our MarTech team and overlook the go-live of new marketing networks as well as tracking improvements, such as deep-links and cross-device tracking;
  • Weave together marketing measurement outputs from incrementality tests, attribution and MMM provided by the Data Science team and help stakeholders interpret results even if those insights are ambiguous;
  • Set up and lead weekly steering meetings with stakeholders to align on findings, identify gaps, and make data-informed budget and strategy decisions.

What You Need To Succeed

  • Experience analyzing and handling data from web and app tracking tools such as GA4 or MMPs for marketing attribution and user journey analysis;
  • Proven track record working with network data such as Google Ads, TikTok or Meta and conducting deep-dives for marketing managers;
  • Comfort working with ambiguous data, and ability to guide stakeholders through uncertainty with clear recommendations;
  • Strong proficiency in SQL;
  • Experience with Looker, including hands-on use of LookML to build and maintain dashboards and data models;
  • Experience in environments with cross-device user behavior (web and app), and understanding of tracking complexities across platforms;
  • Excellent communication and storytelling skills, able to distill complex analyses into simple, impactful narratives.

Nice To Have

  • Experience with SKAN (StoreKit Ad Network) and privacy-preserving attribution methods on iOS;
  • Familiarity with experimentation platforms, uplift modeling, or Bayesian methods;
  • Experience in environments with cross-device user behavior (web and app), and understanding of tracking complexities across platforms.

Why You’ll Love It At Preply

  • An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
  • A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
  • A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
  • Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub;
  • Access to free mental health support platforms;
  • Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
  • The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).

Our Principles

  • Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
  • We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
  • Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
  • Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
  • Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
  • Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
  • Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
  • Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
  • Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
  • One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.

Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Product Analyst, Chat
Description:
Department: Customer Happiness, Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Barcelona

Reporting To: Stanislav Fedyakov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.

The company’s flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and Shein, use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. This Product Analyst will join our Customer Happiness team and focus on enhancing the customer support experience. This includes optimizing chat tools, AI-driven chatbots, and other self-service solutions.

You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Design, Customer Experience, and Product teams.

Key Responsibilities


Provide analytical support to the product and business teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of new product features in terms of revenue and cost
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly highlighting the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing metrics related to chat, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Product / Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Experience in planning data structures for new products and features.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team would deliver.
Strong English speaking skills, both verbally and writing.



Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration; at the moment, those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, the UAE, and Remote.


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in the company’s employee stock options program.
Health Insurance



We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more
HTML:
Department: Customer Happiness, Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Barcelona

Reporting To: Stanislav Fedyakov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.

The company’s flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and Shein, use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. This Product Analyst will join our Customer Happiness team and focus on enhancing the customer support experience. This includes optimizing chat tools, AI-driven chatbots, and other self-service solutions.

You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Design, Customer Experience, and Product teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide analytical support to the product and business teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of new product features in terms of revenue and cost
  • Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly highlighting the importance of your insights.
  • Support and monitor existing metrics related to chat, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
  • Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
  • Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.


Skills, Knowledge & Expertise

  • Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Product / Data Analyst.
  • Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
  • Experience in planning data structures for new products and features.
  • Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests.
  • Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
  • Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
  • Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team would deliver.
  • Strong English speaking skills, both verbally and writing.


Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration; at the moment, those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, the UAE, and Remote.

  • We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
  • A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
  • You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
  • Participation in the company’s employee stock options program.
  • Health Insurance


We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Operations Graduate
Description:
Teladoc Health is a leading company in telemedicine and virtual healthcare, providing digital health services, including online medical consultations, mental health therapy, chronic disease management, and overall wellness solutions. At Teladoc Health, we are revolutionizing access to healthcare with innovative telemedicine solutions. As we continue to increase our global reach and expand our ability to provide virtual care across the world, we are currently recruiting an Operations Analyst working from the Barcelona office.

Are you a tech-savvy Engineering Graduate eager to dive into real-world projects and leave your mark on the healthcare industry? Join our Operations team at Teladoc Health and work on innovative initiatives that help transform how people access and experience healthcare.

What You’ll Do

You’ll gain hands-on experience working on a variety of projects across different domains, such as:


Data analysis: Support projects by analyzing and interpreting data to generate insights and enhance our systems
System optimization: Collaborate on enhancing existing tools, platforms, or processes to improve efficiency and scalability
Cross-functional collaboration: Work closely with diverse teams to solve complex challenges and deliver impactful results
Project Planning and Execution: Develop detailed project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation, to ensure successful delivery
Digital Transformation Leadership: Lead large-scale digital transformation initiatives, coordinating dedicated program and project teams to drive impactful changes
Professional Growth & Exposure: Work alongside experienced and talented professionals from companies such as McKinsey, BCG, and others


What We’re Looking For

We’d love to hear from you if you:


Have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or are currently pursuing one) in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Are fluent in both Spanish and English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Possess excellent organizational and analytical abilities, with a resourceful and problem-solving mindset.
Are an effective communicator, capable of leading multidisciplinary teams and articulating complex ideas clearly.
Have strong interpersonal skills and a passion for building and maintaining long-term stakeholder relationships


How To Apply

Ready to take the next step? Send your CV and a brief cover letter explaining your interest in this position to miriam.cuartero@teladochealth.com

We look forward to welcoming you to our team and helping you grow, innovate, and succeed at Teladoc Health!
Show more

Title: Flight Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

WELCOME TO SITA

We're the team that keeps airports moving, airlines flying smoothly, and borders open. Our tech and communication innovations are the secret behind the success of the world’s air travel industry.

You'll find us at 95% of international hubs. We partner closely with over 2,500 transportation and government clients, each with their own unique needs and challenges. Our goal is to find fresh solutions and cutting-edge tech to make their operations run like clockwork. Want to be a part of something big?

Are you ready to love your job? The adventure begins right here, with you, at SITA.

About The Role & Team

Our OptiFlight solution is a key pillar in SITA’s contribution to a greener, more sustainable aviation through the enablement of flight and air traffic optimization.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Head of OptiOps team, the Customer Applications Support (QAR) team is overall responsible for the following key activities:


Facilitate QAR flow.
Support in the configuration of QAR data decoder for new integrations.
Monitor and manage the quality of decoding.
Continuously Review and improve the overall process flow.



You will learn from an experienced QAR engineers and also interact with the various functions within SITA FOR AIRCRAFT such as Engineering & Technology, Product, and other colleagues across the company, located in 20+ countries (Canada, United-States, France, Switzerland, Germany, Singapore, United Arab Emirates, Spain...).

What You’ll Do

In this role, you will gain hands-on experience in flight data management and optimization through various responsibilities, including:


Assisting in configuring QAR decoders to integrate new aircraft and aircraft types into the SITA for Aircraft library.
Supporting the configuration and maintenance of data flows to ensure seamless data acquisition and processing.
Contributing to the monitoring and validation of data quality by analyzing logs and error files to detect and resolve issues.
Collaborating with the team to troubleshoot data-related problems, optimize decoding processes, and enhance overall system performance.
Participating in continuous improvement initiatives to streamline workflows and enhance the effectiveness of QAR data integration and processing.



This role provides a unique opportunity to work closely with experts and teams across different functions, deepening your understanding of flight data analysis

Qualifications

ABOUT YOUR SKILLS


Degree in Aeronautical Engineering with good knowledge of flight data analysis.
Good understanding of the aeronautical domain.
Minimum 1-2 years of relevant experience in fight data analysis, FOQA or safety related role (SMS).
Knowledge regarding aircraft flight data acquisition system and sensors.
Understanding of aircraft parameters.
Practical experience working with Python and Linux environments.
Git common knowledge.
Proactive with good communication skills.



NICE-TO-HAVE


Bash programming
Flight data decoding skills (ARINC717 & ARINC767)
Knowledge of Rancher (Kubernetes management tool)



What We Offer

We’re all about diversity. We operate in 200 countries and speak 60 different languages and cultures. We’re really proud of our inclusive environment. Our offices are comfortable and fun places to work, and we make sure you get to work from home too. Find out what it's like to join our team and take a step closer to your best life ever.

🏡 Flex Week: Work from home up to 2 days/week (depending on your team’s needs)

⏰ Flex Day: Make your workday suit your life and plans.

🌎 Flex Location: Take up to 30 days a year to work from any location in the world.

🌿Employee Wellbeing: We’ve got you covered with our Employee Assistance Program (EAP), for you and your dependents 24/7, 365 days/year. We also offer Champion Health - a personalized platform that supports a range of wellbeing needs.

🚀Professional Development: Level up your skills with our training platforms, including LinkedIn Learning!

🙌🏽 Competitive Benefits: Competitive benefits that make sense with both your local market and employment status.

SITA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value a diverse workforce. In support of our Employment Equity Program, we encourage women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities to apply and self-identify in the application process.
Show more

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
NTT DATA somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 190.000 profesionales, tan diverso como diversos son los más de 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad.




¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.




Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo.




¿Te gustaría formar parte de este equipo? Buscamos un Digital Analyst para un gran cliente multinacional español del sector textil, que tengan motivación por crecer y desarrollar una carrera profesional dentro del cliente, trabajando en proyectos de gran envergadura, acompañados de un plan de formación y con mucha flexibilidad.




Requisitos

Buen nivel SQL/BigQuery
Conocimientos en analítica web (GA4)
Generación de informes en PowerBI/Tableau
Snowflake Ecosystem
Experiencia trabajando en entornos Cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP)




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Salario competitivo acorde a tu perfil, ámbito de especialización tecnológica y aportación de valor en conocimiento y experiencia.
Proceso de revisiones salariales acorde a la evolución dentro de la cuenta de cliente.
Contrato indefinido a jornada completa y estabilidad laboral.
Beneficios sociales y retribución flexible (opción de seguro médico para ti y tus familiares).
Plan de formación y certificaciones que te permitan desarrollar conocimientos y capacidades dentro de la cuenta del cliente.
Modelo híbrido de teletrabajo, presencialidad en oficina de cliente 2 días a la semana.




Apúntate y ven a formar parte de una de las mayores compañías de IT del mundo. ¡Te estamos esperando!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Scientist / Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Scientist / Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
Data Modelling - Time Series forecasting, A/B Testing
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.







What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Scientist or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gdańsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don’t just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‘Employer of the Year - Media and Entertainment’ category.

So, what’s stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

Additional Information

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Title: Data Analyst Intern ( They/He/She )
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our strong culture and non-vanilla personality.

💪 A Talent House.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts…

YOUR MISSION

Join our team and become an integral part of Glovo's Global Operations! We provide a dynamic and challenging environment filled with numerous opportunities for growth and development.

THE JOURNEY


Define, own, and optimize how we compensate all the orders in Glovo in more than 20 countries.
Understand and address local and regional needs by stepping into the shoes of the couriers and truly understanding their perspective.
Manage dashboards and create new tools to improve the department’s metric visibility.
Develop analytical frameworks and models, while effectively communicating with the entire department.
Dive deep into data to identify key factors and actions to improve KPIs, taking accountability for outcomes.
Innovate to contribute to the ongoing improvement of courier profitability


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor in Engineering, Math, or any technological domain (tech bootcamps)
Passionate about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Problem-solving skills: no problem is too small or too big
Excel / Google Sheets proficiency
Nice to have SQL and Python
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Data Studio & Qlikview is a plus
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills (English is a must)
Proactive, organized, and obsessed with details


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🍔 Monthly Glovo credits to satisfy your cravings!
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our Performance Marketing team in Barcelona at eDreams ODIGEO.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

21 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 7M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 6 billion daily AI predictions[e1]

Over 1,600 employees – More than 60 different nationalities from all continents – 99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world’s leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What You Will Do

The Role’s Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As a Data Analyst in the Performance Marketing team, you will play a key role in optimizing our performance marketing strategies across SEM, Paid Social, Display, Video, and other digital channels for our various products. This is an opportunity to take ownership of complex analytical projects, work with large datasets, and directly influence marketing efficiency, campaign performance, and overall business growth.

Analyzing and Optimizing Performance Marketing Campaigns


Structure, analyze, and interpret data to uncover opportunities to improve SEM, Paid Social, Display, and other digital advertising performance.
Conduct in-depth numerical analysis to identify key drivers, trends, and changes impacting performance marketing efficiency. Collaborate with Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, and marketing teams to maintain, validate, and optimize data sources.
Develop and enhance automated data extraction tools and maintain dashboards for real-time performance tracking.
Provide accurate data, insights, and forecasts to stakeholders, supporting data-driven decision-making.
Identify and deliver actionable insights that drive growth and improve overall marketing strategies.



Delivering Insights & Recommendations


Present findings, analysis, and recommendations in a clear, concise manner, tailoring communication for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Use multiple formats (reports, dashboards, presentations) to facilitate decision-making and optimize marketing investments.
Enhancing Analytics Capabilities
Research and implement advanced tools, models, and methodologies to further strengthen our analytics toolkit.
Continuously explore new ways to enhance data processes and improve the efficiency of performance tracking across various digital marketing channels.



What You Need To Succeed

Job Requirements

Must-haves


Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics or a related field.
Technical Skills: 2+ years of experience working with SQL, Python, and BI/visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, MicroStrategy).
Data Proficiency: Experience working with large datasets, performing complex analyses, and integrating data from various sources.
Business Acumen: Strong understanding of how data insights impact performance marketing strategy and business growth.
Analytical Mindset: Ability to extract insights from data and provide actionable recommendations.
Curiosity & Problem-Solving: Passion for exploring data, uncovering actionable insights, and continually seeking innovative analytical approaches.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Self-Starter & Organised: Methodical and detail-oriented, able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while working autonomously and collaboratively within a team.



Preferable


Advanced Analytical Experience: 3+ years of experience in a data-driven analytical role.
Performance Marketing Expertise:Strong understanding of digital advertising channels (e.g., SEM, Paid Social, Display, Video), with bonus points for experience in the travel industry.
Web & Marketing Analytics: Experience with Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or other marketing measurement tools.
Experience with Applied AI Tools: Demonstrated comfort using practical AI tools such as GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, or other AI-powered coding assistants.
Experimentation Mindset: Curiosity and eagerness to explore, experiment with, and integrate emerging AI-driven solutions into software development workflows.
AI-Enhanced Problem Solving: Ability to effectively leverage AI tools to debug code, streamline development processes, and enhance productivity.
Adaptability and Learning Agility: Enthusiastic about continuously learning and quickly adapting to new AI features and capabilities.
Collaboration with AI: Experience or interest in collaborating closely with AI tools as “pair programmers” to complement traditional software development practices.



What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here’s what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it’s like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.

Title: Analista de Datos (H/M)
Description:
En Empresas IMAN, estamos en búsqueda de un Analista de Datos para formar parte del equipo de Servicios Centrales con sede en Terrassa.

El candidato incorporado será el encargado de transformar datos en información útil para la toma de decisiones, además de diseñar soluciones que optimicen procesos mediante herramientas.




Funciones:

Desarrollo de Informes y Dashboards en Power BI.

Crear y mantener reportes interactivos que visualicen datos de forma clara.
Optimizar modelos de datos y aplicar fórmulas DAX para obtener métricas relevantes.

Integración y Gestión de Datos

Consolidar información proveniente de bases de datos, APIs, archivos y otras fuentes.
Diseñar y optimizar procesos ETL para garantizar la integridad y precisión de los datos.
Gestionar y mejorar consultas SQL y almacenes de datos.

Calidad y Seguridad de la Información

Implementar controles para asegurar la calidad y seguridad de los datos.
Aplicar normativas y buenas prácticas en la gestión y protección de la información.

Colaboración con Equipos de Negocio

Trabajar conjuntamente con otros departamentos para identificar necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones de datos.
Presentar de forma clara los insights y recomendaciones a los distintos stakeholders.




Requisitos:

Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de informes en Power BI y aplicaciones en PowerApps.
Valorable conocimientos en integración de datos, procesos ETL y optimización de consultas SQL.
Valorable capacidad analítica, orientada a la solución de problemas y al trabajo en equipo.
Habilidad para comunicar hallazgos técnicos a audiencias no especializadas.
Residir en Terrassa o alrededores.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contratación indefinida. Posición estable.
Jornada completa de lunes a viernes de 9 a 18. Flexibilidad.
Salario a negociar según experiencia y expectativas.

Show more
