Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.


DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

  • DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;


  • DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;


  • DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.


Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.


We are looking for an Finance Data Analyst!


Responsibilities:

  • Analyse and interpret financial data focusing on IFRS13.
  • Developing analytical models for Position, PnL and Mark to Market, valuation etc.
  • Build and maintain financial data transformation & reports and dashboards for internal stakeholders.
  • Maintain finance master data governance model. · Ensure data accuracy and support automation of recurring reporting tasks.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. · 1–3 years of experience in financial or data analysis.
  • Working knowledge of IFRS 13 and financial instrument valuation. · Strong analytical mindset and attention to detail.
  • Advanced Excel (formulas, pivot tables, Power Query).
  • SQL for querying and managing financial datasets. · Basic knowledge of AI models related to Finance is a Plus.
  • Power BI or Qlik sense or Open source (Apache Superset..) for data visualization and reporting.
  • Familiarity with financial systems or market data platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters) is a plus
  • Proficiency in English.


If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/FinanceDataAnalyst”.


Thank You! 😊

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Our Functions teams are right at the centre of our business, making sure we can always get better, every day. Supporting the business with things like Marketing, Human Resources, Finance, Legal and Technology, our Functions colleagues are skilled professionals whose role it is to ensure we continue to become an indispensable partner to brands everywhere.

Job Details

About the BI Team: The Kantar BI team is a dynamic, integrated function that delivers expert data tools and insights to Finance across Kantar. Our primary focus is to empower business teams with seamless access to high-quality data while managing best-in-class business intelligence solutions. By enhancing data quality and streamlining BI processes, we drive operational excellence and elevate the overall business experience.

Why this job is important

As a Business Intelligence Analyst within Kantar’s BI team, you will play a key role in executing and supporting the company’s business intelligence strategy. Reporting directly to the BI Manager, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality reporting, analytics, and data-driven insights that align with strategic objectives. Your contributions will help transform raw data into valuable business intelligence, whether through reports, analyses, or by enhancing the team’s existing BI assets.

What You’ll Be Doing


Project Ownership: Take charge of assigned projects, ensuring alignment with team priorities and strategic goals. Oversee the entire delivery process from inception to completion, adhering to deadlines and maintaining quality standards.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Create and sustain strategic dashboards, offering data-driven insights regarding performance across all financial dimensions.
Stakeholder Management: Manage stakeholder expectations throughout the project lifecycle. Provide regular updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure deliverables meet stakeholder requirements.
Advanced Analytics Support: Facilitate the application of advanced analytics models, such as forecasting, collaborating with the BI Manager to ensure new models are seamlessly incorporated into existing systems and processes.
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives by identifying areas for process optimization and innovation. Support the team’s efforts to enhance reporting and analytics capabilities by facilitating automation of reporting with BI Tools.
Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with all team members to ensure effective collaboration. Communicate effectively to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
Training & Education: Participate in training and education programs to enhance your BI skills and knowledge. Support the broader team’s efforts to promote a data-driven culture within the organisation.


The Skills & Experience Needed As Business Intelligence Analyst


Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, engineering, data science, computer science, or a related field.
Experience: Previous experience in a business intelligence, data analysis, or similar role.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in BI tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, or MicroStrategy), data analysis techniques, and proficiency in Excel. Familiarity with ERP Reporting Platforms (Maconomy, SAP, Oracle) is a plus.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Task Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with team priorities.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage effectively with senior stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to problem-solving, with the ability to identify challenges and develop effective solutions.
Collaboration: A team player with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional environment.


What’s In It For You


Flexible hybrid working
Up to 25 days off, plus your birthday off and two days paid for volunteering
Meal card and flexible benefits where you are allocated funds to spend on a variety of benefits such as transport cost, education related and more


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.


Show more

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for an Data & Reporting Analyst!




Requirements:

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity, or other relevant area for the position.
Very good professional practice of English (French is a plus).
At least 5 years of professional experience in data analysis.
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.
Expertise in Power Bi is mandatory.
Ability to be autonomous.
Commitment to the job and the team objectives.
Systematic, critical, and logical thinking.
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.
Aim to deliver very high-quality results.
Respect the procedures, methodologies, and directives.
Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.
Good listening and questioning ability.
Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.
Good team working ability.
Rigorous.
Client oriented.
Collaborative working skills.
Adaptation capacity.
Analytical skills.
Very Good level of english.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV in to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/Data&Reporting”.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Quantitative Data & BI Specialist - Tableau
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.







🔎We are looking for a Quantitative Data & BI Specialist - Tableau




MAIN TASKS:

Data Visualization:

Design and develop interactive Tableau dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights.
Ensure dashboards are user-friendly, visually appealing, and aligned with business requirements.

Data Management:

Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and availability.
Work with large datasets, perform data cleansing, and optimize data queries for performance.

Stakeholder Collaboration:

Engage with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that meet their objectives.
Conduct training sessions and workshops to educate users on how to effectively use Tableau dashboards.

Maintenance and Support:

Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Tableau dashboards and reports.
Continuously monitor and improve the performance of existing dashboards.

Documentation:

Maintain detailed documentation of all dashboards, reports, and data sources.

Keep up to date with the latest Tableau features and best practices.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Academic background in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.
Professional experience as a Tableau Developer (at least 2 years).




Technical Skills:

Proficiency in Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server.
Strong SQL skills and experience with databases (e.g., MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Knowledge of other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, QlikView) is a plus.

Analytical Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to interpret complex data and translate it into meaningful insights.

Communication Skills:

Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluency in written and spoken English.

Other Skills:

Detail-oriented with a strong focus on data accuracy.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines
Familiarity with agile methodologies and project management tools.
Knowledge in financial markets is a plus (fx, credit, rates, commodities).
Hybrid role based in Porto or Lisbon







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (“RISK MFI”) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (“GM”) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are


Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.


Profile And Skills To Success


A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
Master’s degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it’s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us – growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.

For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!

Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.

Your Mission Will Be


Collaborate with stakeholders across various sectors to identify and understand their analytical needs and challenges;
Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for enhancement and customization;
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI, ensuring they deliver actionable insights;
Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.


You Will Need


Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
Experience working with Snowflake and Azure Databricks;
Fluency in Portuguese and English;
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.


Would Be Awesome If You Have


BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
Experience working with SQL Server.


With Us You Can Be a


TechThinker – people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver – strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
InnoMinder – inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher – no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!


Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Associate
Description:
Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Design visually appealing and business useful reports.
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture.
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports.
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling.
Preparing and facilitating workshops.
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives.



What you’ll bring


3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.
Show more
